rComments: Talk with David, he's an inspiration for me and many of my peers; a brilliant lecturer and amazing teaching (OH are a must).  160 makes you a bioinformatician: it was challenging.  Show up to class and he will give you answers. Not everything said in class is on the slides! - that is key, the help he gives in class is worthy of your time.

Dr. Bernick is a really passionate guy with a deep background in virology. Each lecture was hugely enriching. I loved seeing his perspective on science and nature. His positivity and energy made the class a lot of fun. Thanks Dr. Bernick!

Amazing professor. Very helpful, loves the area of study and wants to see his students succeed. He is always open to questions and readily admits when he does not know the answer. The class was amazing, there are not many classes where one can discover an entirely new species of virus as a freshman. Probably  the best class I have taken this year.

David is the best and BME 110 isn't particularly hard. There were only five fairly easy assignments and he gave extensions when the class asked for them. The tests were fairly easy(multiple choice) and it was clear that he didn't care much for tests/they weren't that important. Recommend watching webcasts when studying. Only bad - grader slow.
Excellent professor, you have to work hard as  the classes tend to move fast but as long as you stay on top of it you will learn a lot.

He sucks at explaining stuff. Read the book if you want to learn the subject. The TA's will help you get through the course. Take the class only if you are a good self leaner.  Avoid this guy at all costs.

This was one of the most difficult classes I've ever taken. It was my first bioinformatics class, and it you will definitely need to work for your grade in this one. Still, what you learn is extremely useful. Everyone should have at least some exposure to computational biologybioinformatics. It will help you.

Very difficult teacher, and if you don't have bioinformatics or programming experience, prepare to work a little harder, VERY WORTH IT: go to office hours!  His lectures can be hard to follow, but he is very willing to help you if you talk to him. One of my best and favorite teachers, If you have the chance to take his class, please do!

He is the best teacher I have ever had. He wants the students to learn and puts a lot of effort into helping you! He is a genius so he makes his classes kind of hard... you will have to work for your grades. Very rewarding and I learned a lot. The class is more enjoyable if you have programming experience.
Very difficult class, particularly if you don't have any prior programming experience. However, if you attend the professor's office hours regularly, as well as the lab times, you'll do well.

This was a VERY difficult class for most people I spoke with. He did a good job changing due dates as needed to allow at least some of us to manage it. That being said, I had biology/CS experience, and research experience in BME...and it was still HARD...but claims to require no experience. And, a 93% overall average is only worth an A-! Watch out!
